subject: RE: [junit] File Diff in JUnit
msgSnippet: I will simply repost the code that was sent to me originally when I posted ... FileReader(fileToRead)); ... Good luck. Jim JM ... From: Vitezslav Stejskal
messageBody:
I will simply repost the code that was sent to me originally when I posted
the same question:


> I don't have one coded up in a base class, but here is the code I use...
>
> public void assertFilesEqual(File fileOne, File fileTwo) {
> assertEquals(readFile(fileOne), readFile(fileTwo));
> }
>
> private static String readFile(File fileToRead) {
> StringBuffer fileContents = new StringBuffer("");
> try {
> BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new
FileReader(fileToRead));
> String line;
> while ((line = in.readLine()) != null) {
> fileContents.append(line+"\n");
> }
> in.close();
> } catch (Exception e) {
> System.err.println(e.toString());
> return "";
> }
> return new String (fileContents);
> }
>


Good luck.

Jim JM

-----Original Message-----
From: Vitezslav Stejskal [mailto:vitezslav.stejskal@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 13, 2001 7:55 AM
To: junit
Subject: [junit] File Diff in JUnit


Hi All,

I am the Netbeans developer working on integration
of JUnit test framework to Netbeans IDE. I would like to
ask, if there are plans to have file-diff capabality included in JUnit.

My idea is to implement assertFile(file1, file2) method,
which will compare two files and produce the file containing
differences (if there will be some).

As long as this is crutial for netbeans internal tests, I am able
to spend some time by the developement on that field. I would
like to know if there is already some work done or if there is
anybody willing to cooperate.

Thanks for your response,
Vita


--
Vitezslav Stejskal, Software engineer
